College Intern - Environmental, Health & Safety (EHS) Compliance

 

Sustainagility provides environmental, health and safety (EHS) risk management solutions to businesses located nationwide. Our job is to cost-effectively assist our clients in balancing the bottom-line with the local, state, and federal regulatory requirements, both new and old. Because we work with varied industries in several locales, members of our team have the opportunity to gain experience in numerous areas within the EHS field.

 

We are looking for a part-time intern to work remotely. This position will become available in September 2021 and applicants must currently be enrolled in a degree program at an accredited college or university.

 

Sustainagility will provide you with training and experience in various environmental and safety programs as you complete your degree. Our new intern can expect to receive:

\u00b7        One-on-one training

\u00b7        Practical experience

\u00b7        Competitive salary

\u00b7        Resume-enhancing skills

\u00b7        Possible future employment

 

In this position, as an important part of our EHS Team, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

\u00b7        Work on independent and collaborative projects

\u00b7        Provide support for management

\u00b7        Research local hazardous material reporting requirements

\u00b7        Update emergency response documentation

\u00b7        Develop emergency evacuation plans

\u00b7        Monitor and update project schedules

\u00b7        Create informational EHS content (e.g., blog, social media)

 

A successful applicant will possess the following qualifications:

\u00b7        Eagerness to learn

\u00b7        Pursuing a Bachelor\u2019s degree

\u00b7        Educational course history related to environmental, health and safety programs

\u00b7        Proficiency with Microsoft Office

\u00b7        Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

 

Requirements for applying:

\u00b7        Must be a U.S. Citizen or have Resident Alien status

 

Applications must include:

\u00b7        Resume

\u00b7        Cover letter (preferred but not required)

\u00b7        Current major

\u00b7        Expected graduation date

\u00b7        A copy of your unofficial transcript

 

Compensation and benefits:

\u00b7        This is a paid internship with hourly rates between $12.00 and $17.00

\u00b7        This is a remote, work-from-home position

\u00b7        We offer schedule flexibility (10 to 20 hours per week M-F)

 

We are an equal opportunity employer:

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.
